result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark E Hughes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25  + costs = $484.50, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 10/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

--to submit a DNA sample today to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Hughes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:33am [mo]
Defendant Mark E Hughes in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $25  + costs = $484.50, to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 10/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 8 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
--to submit a DNA sample today to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept.

1 day sentence credit 
recess: 9:48am
Defendant in custody/ Duplicate Original Warrant Returned from JCSD

[MK] case called at 1:45pm. 
Defendant Mark E Hughes appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court informs the parties that this case is assigned to Judge Wambach/Branch III. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Mr. Hughes verifies that the date of birth and address on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Edward Tews
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:49pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/12/15 at 10:20am  (2) Status Conference on 9/1/15 at 9:00am
NEW DATE/TIME FOR INITIAL APPEARANCE MUST BE GIVEN BEFORE RELEASE

Case called at 3:23 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for initial appearance)
Defendant Mark E Hughes not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict or need to recuse or disqualify
ADA Hall requests probable cause warrant
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Count #1
Court orders issuance of arrest warrant-Defendant may post $500 cash in lieu of arrest as long as a new date/time is given for rescheduled initial appearance
Recess: 3:29 pm
